results.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Fred Kohlmar and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Lucy Muir (Gene Tierney) a beautiful widow and her daughter (Natalie Wood) rent a house by the ocean, and refuse to be frightened by the former owner’s ghost, a dashing sea captain (Rex Harrison). When her income suddenly stops, he suggests that they collaborate on a book about his life and the unlikely pair fall deeply in love. Then Lucy’s affection is challenged by a live man (George Sanders), leaving the broken-hearted captain to choose another course. Acclaimed for its heartwarming screenplay and Oscar-nominated cinematography, this film is a moving, sentimental Hollywood classic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Fred Kohlmar and Joseph L Mankiewicz

results.title: The Getting of Wisdom [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Southern Cross Film Productions, Phillip Adams and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: Laura Tweedle Ramsbotham is about to enter another world. From her home in sleepy, rural Australia she ascends to the dreaming spires of an exclusive college for young ladies, a very strict Victorian boarding school in Melbourne. Laura (Susannah Fowles) is strong willed and rebellious, which creates conflict with her peers and her teachers. In a desperate attempt to find acceptance with her peers, she weaves the most lurid yarns imaginable. The only real soulmate she finds is one of the senior girls. This novel by Henry Handel Richardson was published in 1910, and was so shocking at the time that the author’s name (Ethel Richardson) was stricken from the records of the school in which she set the thinly-disguised autobiography. An amusing and sometimes touching story which features an excellent performance from Barry Humphries as the repressed fire and brimstone minister. Also stars John Waters, Sheila Helpman, Patricia Kennedy and Julie Blake.

results.title: The Getaway
results.creator_credit: First Artists, David Foster, Mitchell Brower and Sam Peckinpah
results.brief_description: In one of his most hard-bitten roles, Steve McQueen plays “Doc” McCoy, a master thief who is released on a parole arranged by his wife (Ali MacGraw) who sleeps with a political big shot. In return for this favour, McCoy must lead a group of professional thieves on a bank heist, including his wife as the getaway driver. What follows is a sinister succession of double-crosses that sour the deal until the final climactic shoot-out. This violent film, typical of Peckinpah, relentlessly depicts ruthless robbery and murder, not to mention adultery, kidnapping, bribery, extortion and general mayhem. No-one in this film is honourable or attractive, and yet the viewer finds themself actually hoping that McQueen and MacGraw, thieves though they are, will get away. Cast includes: Steve McQueen, Ali MacGraw, Ben Johnson, Sally Struthers, Al Lettieri and Slim Pickens.

results.title: The Germination and growth of plants
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Peter Boulton
results.brief_description: Explains the origins of fruits, the general structure of seeds and through simple classroom experiments, the conditions necessary for germination. Examines hypogeal and epigeal germination and presents the early development of seedlings using time lapse techniques following root system development and shoot growth. Accompanied by an 8p. Study Guide.

results.title: The German sheepdog
results.creator_credit: EFVA and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The life of sheepdogs on the central uplands of Germany. Shows how the dogs guard the sheep and lead them from pasture. Studies the main stages in the development of a litter from a week after birth. Gives an impression of the very different life of a dog that has been trained as a house dog. Intended for children aged 7-10.

results.title: The German language series. Part 4
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: This series allows the student to hear and see native speakers of German conducting a conversation lasting about two minutes. The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part four presents dialogue on the building of a new house, using basic sounds in complex sentences. In English and German.

results.title: The German language series. Part 3
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: This series allows the student to hear and see native speakers of German conducting a conversation lasting about two minutes. The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part three presents dialogue on a picnic students are planning, using sentences of different structural types. In English and German.

results.title: The German language series. Part 2
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel

The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part two presents dialogue on departure for a skiing trip, using various tenses. In English and German.

results.title: The German language series. Part 1
results.creator_credit: University of Wisconsin and Herman J. Engel
results.brief_description: This series allows the student to hear and see native speakers of German conducting a conversation lasting about two minutes. The dialogue is broken down into parts which are repeated four times to allow the student to imitate the pronunciation and intonation of the speaker. Part one presents dialogue on the arrival in Germany of a friend from America, using simple sentences with present tense. In English and German.

results.title: The Geography of Canada
results.brief_description: Documentary short on Canada’s geographical regions - the Pacific West Coast, the Interior Plains, the Canadian Shield, the St. Lawrence Valley, Appalachian region; and the arctic. Both animated dolls and live footage are used to provide facts on plant and animal life, Canada’s neighbours, climatic conditions, natural resources and wildlife conservation. Scenes of a beaver building a dam.
